column4: hey guys, quick question, does anyone know the user smb runs as?
Whatcha mean? smbd itself runs as root, but forks for each user.
basicly i want to smb in to /var/www i have it working so that only local machines to my network can use smb on the server but for some reason i cant get write permsion from smb in /var/www
i have tried everything i can think of changing owner ship changing group chmod -R 777 everything
You need to make local users, and grant them access to the server, and establish either NT hashes or kerberos keys for them.
Are you using AD?
Or just plain two windows machines?
i dont know what AD is and shea i think i did, and wasabi_ again, it is ubuntu server as smbServer and then a windows machine connects to it
You need to make a user for the windows user.
and run smbpasswd to set it's password.
The usernames much match.
i have done that
the problem is that from smb i can not get write persission at /var/www, that is the only directoy that does not work
Does the user you made have write access?
when i log in to the box from ssh i can mod the files in /var/www with out needing to sudo or change users
Other than setting read only = No in smb.conf, that's all you need to do
i had writable = yes should that be read only = no?
No, those are equivelent. I'd read the log files.
ok i will dive in to the logs and then come back here if i cant get it still thanks man
thanks for the log idea, turns out  that i had a printer in there that was erroring and that one below the printer, i removed the errored printer and poof it works
Heh.
